Package Green

Class World

java.lang.Object
Green.World
public abstract class World extends Object
The base class for all worlds in the library. A world is its own area for a collection of Actor instances to interact in, though any given Actor can be within multiple worlds at a time. Only one world may be active at a time however, which can be changed by calling Green.loadWorld(World).
Author:
Zacchary Dempsey-Plante

    • World

      public World​(int w, int h, processing.core.PImage bgImage, int resizeFormat)
      Creates a new world with defined dimensions and a background image. Also supplies a resizing format.
      Parameters:
      w - The width to create the world with.
      h - The height to create the world with.
      bgImage - The background image.
      resizeFormat - The background image resize format to use. It must be either Green.BILINEAR, Green.NEAREST_NEIGHBOR, or Green.TILE.
      Throws:
      UnknownResizeFormatException - Thrown when an unknown resize format is supplied.

    • World

      public World​(int w, int h, int bgColor, processing.core.PImage bgImage, int resizeFormat)

      Throws:
      UnknownResizeFormatException - Thrown when an unknown resize format is supplied.

    • getUuid

      public final UUID getUuid()
      Retrieves the UUID of the World. This value is unique to each World instance, and cannot be modified.
      Returns:
      The unique instance ID.

      public final int getWidth()
      Retrieves the width of the World.
      Returns:
      The width.

      public final int getHeight()
      Retrieves the height of the World.

      public final int getBackgroundColor()
      Retrieves the background colour of the World. This is drawn-over if a background image is set.
      Returns:
      The background colour of the World.

    • getSourceBackgroundImage

      public final processing.core.PImage getSourceBackgroundImage()
      Retrieves the original image supplied as the background image, before any scaling has been applied.
      Returns:

    • getBackgroundImage

      public final processing.core.PImage getBackgroundImage()
      Retrieves the background image currently in use, with scaling applied.
      Returns:
      The background image currently in use, with scaling applied.

    • getOutOfBoundsColor

      public final int getOutOfBoundsColor()
      Retrieves the out-of-bounds colour of the World. This is only applicable if setCamFollowActor(Actor) is in use, or the screen size is larger than the size of the World.
      Returns:
      The out-of-bounds colour of the World.

    • getUnbounded

      public final boolean getUnbounded()
      Retrieves whether the World has 'collidable' boundaries that prevent Actor instances from going out-of-bounds.
      Returns:
      Whether the World has 'collidable' boundaries.

    • getOnlyDrawOnScreen

      public final boolean getOnlyDrawOnScreen()
      Retrieves whether the World should attempt to render Actor instances that are not on-screen. In normal use, there shouldn't be a reason for this to be modified. By default, the World does not render things that aren't on-screen.
      Returns:
      Whether the World attempts to render Actor instances that are not on-screen.

    • getCamFollowActor

      public final Actor getCamFollowActor()
      Retrieves the Actor the camera should follow, if it is set.
      Returns:
      The Actor the camera should follow, if it is set.

    • getActorUnsafeRemove

      public final boolean getActorUnsafeRemove()
      Retrieves the current setting for whether the World should remove Actor instances safely.
      Returns:
      The current setting for whether the World should remove Actor instances safely.

    • getResizeFormat

      public final int getResizeFormat()
      Retrieves the background image resize format of the World.
      Returns:
      The background image resize format - either Green.BILINEAR, Green.NEAREST_NEIGHBOR, or Green.TILE.

    • getObjects

      public final List<Actor> getObjects()
      Retrieves a list of all Actor instances in the World.
      Returns:
      A list of all Actor instances in the World.

    • getObjects

      public final <A extends Actor> List<A> getObjects​(Class<A> type)
      Retrieves a list of all Actor instances matching type in the World.
      Type Parameters:
      A - The type of Actor to filter by, as defined by type.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of Actor to filter by.
      Returns:
      A list of all Actor instances matching type.

    • getRandomObject

      public final <A extends Actor> A getRandomObject​(Class<A> type)
      Retrieves a single random Actor matching type in the World, or null if the World has no objects.
      Type Parameters:
      A - The type of Actor to filter by, as defined by type.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of Actor to filter by.
      Returns:
      A single random Actor matching type, or null if the World has no objects.

    • setWidth

      public final void setWidth​(int width)
      Sets the width of the World. This operation may be expensive, depending on the number of Actor instances, whether setUnbounded(boolean) has been used, etc.
      Parameters:
      width - The width to set.

    • setHeight

      public final void setHeight​(int height)
      Sets the height of the World. This operation may be expensive, depending on the number of Actor instances, whether setUnbounded(boolean) has been used, etc.
      Parameters:
      height - The height to set.

    • setDimensions

      public final void setDimensions​(int width, int height)
      Sets the dimensions of the World. This operation may be expensive, depending on the number of Actor instances, whether setUnbounded(boolean) has been used, etc.
      Parameters:
      width - The width to set.
      height - The height to set.

    • setBackgroundColor

      public final void setBackgroundColor​(int newColour)
      Sets the background colour of the World. This is drawn-over if a background image is set.
      Parameters:
      newColour - The colour to set as the background colour. Use the PApplet.color(int, int, int) method to define it.

    • setBackgroundColor

      public final void setBackgroundColor​(int newColourR, int newColourG, int newColourB)
      Sets the background colour of the World. This is drawn-over if a background image is set.
      Parameters:
      newColourR - The value in range 0 - 255 to use as the red channel in the background colour.
      newColourG - The value in range 0 - 255 to use as the green channel in the background colour.
      newColourB - The value in range 0 - 255 to use as the blue channel in the background colour.

    • setBackgroundImage

      public final void setBackgroundImage​(processing.core.PImage image)
      Sets the background image of the World.
      Parameters:
      image - The image to set as the background.

    • setOutOfBoundsColor

      public final void setOutOfBoundsColor​(int newColour)
      Sets the out-of-bounds colour of the World. This is only applicable if setCamFollowActor(Actor) is in use, or the screen size is larger than the size of the World.
      Parameters:
      newColour - The colour to set as the out-of-bounds colour. Use the PApplet.color(int, int, int) method to define it.

    • setOutOfBoundsColor

      public final void setOutOfBoundsColor​(int newColourR, int newColourG, int newColourB)
      Sets the out-of-bounds colour of the World. This is only applicable if setCamFollowActor(Actor) is in use, or the screen size is larger than the size of the World.
      Parameters:
      newColourR - The value in range 0 - 255 to use as the red channel in the out-of-bounds colour.
      newColourG - The value in range 0 - 255 to use as the green channel in the out-of-bounds colour.
      newColourB - The value in range 0 - 255 to use as the blue channel in the out-of-bounds colour.

    • setUnbounded

      public final void setUnbounded​(boolean unbounded)
      Sets whether the World has 'collidable' boundaries that prevent Actor instances from going out-of-bounds.
      Parameters:
      unbounded - Whether the World has 'collidable' boundaries.

    • setOnlyDrawOnScreen

      public final void setOnlyDrawOnScreen​(boolean onlyDrawOnScreen)
      Sets whether the World should attempt to render Actor instances that are not on-screen. In normal use, there shouldn't be a reason for this to be modified. By default, the World does not render things that aren't on-screen.
      Parameters:
      onlyDrawOnScreen - Whether the World should attempt to render Actor instances that are not on-screen.

    • setCamFollowActor

      public final void setCamFollowActor​(Actor newActor)
      Sets the Actor the camera should follow.
      Parameters:
      newActor - The Actor the camera should follow.

    • setActorUnsafeRemove

      public final void setActorUnsafeRemove​(boolean unsafeRemove)
      Sets whether the World should remove Actor instances safely. In some niche cases it may be handy to set this to true, but only if you know what you are doing.
      Parameters:
      unsafeRemove - Whether the World should remove Actor instances safely.

    • setResizeFormat

      public final void setResizeFormat​(int format)
      Sets the background image resize format of the World.
      Parameters:
      format - The background image resize format to set. It must be either Green.BILINEAR, Green.NEAREST_NEIGHBOR, or Green.TILE.
      Throws:
      UnknownResizeFormatException - Thrown when an unknown resize format is supplied.

    • addObject

      public final void addObject​(Actor obj)
      Adds an Actor to the World.
      Parameters:
      obj - The Actor to add to the World.

    • removeObject

      public final void removeObject​(Actor obj)
      Removes an Actor from the World. It either removes it right away (unsafe) or waits to remove it at the end of the frame (safe) based on the value set by setActorUnsafeRemove(boolean). The default value is safe.
      Parameters:
      obj - The Actor to remove from the World.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when obj is not in the World.

    • hasObject

      public final boolean hasObject​(Actor findActor)
      Determines whether the World contains findActor.
      Parameters:
      findActor - The Actor to check for the existence of.
      Returns:
      Whether the World contains findActor.

    • handleDraw

      public final void handleDraw()
      Deprecated.
      Please call Green.handleDraw() instead - this will still be called, but the parent method does additional important things.
      Calls the Actor.draw() method on every Actor in the World, drawing all objects in the World to screen.

    • handleAct

      public final void handleAct()
      Deprecated.
      Please call Green.handleAct() instead - this will still be called, but the parent method does additional important things.
      Calls the Actor.act(float) method on every Actor in the World.

    • prepare

      public abstract void prepare()
      Called when the World is loaded via the Green.loadWorld(World) method.

    • act

      public abstract void act​(float deltaTime)
      Called once per frame.
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - The time, in seconds, since the last time this method was called.
